ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

causeCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIndexedCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.
Each of these errors MUST have index set.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIsInternal.description: If true, then the cause (`causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection`) should be hidden from the user.

causeSimple.description:
Simple string error type.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

code.description:
the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

Deprecated: Prefer to check the request's HTTP response code directly.

details.description:
The optional details of the error response.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeSimple`.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

Deprecated: Use "values" instead.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "type" field.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists.
This needs to be flexible so we can support multiple formats.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeCollection` or `causeIndexedCollection` instead.

internal.description:
Internal error code number.

Deprecated: "type" & "domain" should be used instead to uniquely identify this error.

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request.

type.description:
Type defines a unique identifier for the error, within the domain.
This may be used (along with the domain) to find an internationalization translation for the message.

SHOULD be a valid golang identifier, and SHOULD be in UpperCamelCase.

values.description:
Associated data/information.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted with information from this dictionary.

Note that this map MUST NOT contain JSON objects (`{...}`) or arrays (`[...]`), only simple JSON types are permitted.

ErrorResponse.title: Generic error response for REST APIs.

ack.description: acknowledge or reject the input request

input.description: provide a json blob to the workflow

com.nokia.eda.os.v1alpha1.DeployImage.description: DeployImage is the Schema for the deployimages API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to os.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to DeployImage

spec.description:
Upgrade / downgrade images on targets.
This workflow can be used directly on a target or list of targets, or with selectors to select targets through labels.
It also supports tranches, which are groups of targets that can be upgraded together.
By default a set of checks are run before and after the image change, but this can be controlled via the checks field.
It also supports canaries, which are upgraded before any other targets.

canaries.description:
List of node selectors to use to match canary nodes.
This matches labels on TopoNode resources, including those TopoNodes in the list of nodes that will be imaged.
Canary nodes are upgraded before any other nodes, and are used to test images before broader roll out.
This is a list of label expressions, e.g. ["eda.nokia.com/role=canary"].
canaries.title: Canaries

checks.description:
Checks to run before (pre) and after (post) any image changes.
If none are specified, a default set of checks will be run.
checks.title: Checks to Run

force.description: Ignore result of pre and post checks, do not prompt on failure.
force.title: Force

skip.description: Do not run any checks pre or post image change.
skip.title: Skip Checks

drains.description: Configure drains to gracefully drain traffic away from nodes before imaging.

minimumWaitTimeSeconds.description:
Seconds to wait before rebooting a node after it has been drained.
This is used to allow time for any traffic to drain away from the node before reboot.
minimumWaitTimeSeconds.title: Minimum Wait Time

skip.description: Do not run any drain operations. Nodes will be rebooted without attempting to gracefully drain them.
skip.title: Skip Drains

drains.title: Drains

nodeProfile.description:
Destination profile to use for imaging.
This profile contains the image to deploy, and other configuration for the node.
nodeProfile.title: Node Profile

nodeSelectors.description:
List of node selectors to select nodes to deploy images on.
This matches labels on TopoNode resources, including those TopoNodes in the list of nodes that will be imaged.
If no nodes are specified, and no node selectors are specified, all nodes in the given namespace will be selected.
This is a list of label expressions, e.g. ["eda.nokia.com/role=leaf"].
nodeSelectors.title: Node Selectors

nodes.description: List of nodes to deploy images on.
nodes.title: Nodes

prompt.description:
Control when to prompt the user for input.
If any pre or post checks fail, the user will be prompted for input, but this may be used to prompt even if they're successful.
prompt.title: Prompt

reconnectionTimeoutSeconds.description: Seconds to wait for node to come back online after reboot.
reconnectionTimeoutSeconds.title: ReconnectionTimeout

tranches.description:
List of tranches to use for imaging.
A tranche is a list of node selectors, and a name.
Tranches are upgraded in order, sequentially.

name.description:
Name of the tranche.
This is used to identify the tranche in the UI and in logs.
name.title: Name

nodeSelectors.description:
Node Selectors is a list of node selectors to select nodes to deploy images on in this tranche.
This matches labels on TopoNode resources, including those TopoNodes in the list of nodes that will be imaged.
This is a list of label expressions, e.g. ["eda.nokia.com/role=leaf"].
nodeSelectors.title: Node Selectors

tranches.title: Tranches

spec.title: Specification

drainedTime.description:
The time when the node was drained.
This is the time when the node was drained before the imaging operation.
drainedTime.title: Drained Time

newNodeProfile.description: The new profile of the node.
newNodeProfile.title: New Node Profile

newVersion.description: The new version of the node.
newVersion.title: New Version

node.description: The name of the node this result is for.
node.title: Node

postCheckSuccessful.description:
Indicates if post checks were successful for this node.
This is true if all post checks passed, false if any post checks failed.
postCheckSuccessful.title: Post Check Successful

preCheckSuccessful.description:
Indicates if pre checks were successful for this node.
This is true if all pre checks passed, false if any pre checks failed.
preCheckSuccessful.title: Pre Check Successful

previousNodeProfile.description:
The previous profile of the node.
This is the node profile that was running before the imaging operation.
previousNodeProfile.title: Previous Node Profile

previousVersion.description:
The previous version of the node.
This is the version of the image that was running before the imaging operation.
previousVersion.title: Previous Version

rebootRecoveryTime.description:
The time when the node was recovered after reboot.
This is the time when the node was recovered after the imaging operation.
rebootRecoveryTime.title: Reboot Recovery Time

rebootTime.description:
The time when the node was rebooted.
This is the time when the node was rebooted during the imaging operation.
rebootTime.title: Reboot Time

success.description:
Indicates if the imaging operation was successful for this node.
This is true if the imaging operation was successful, false if it failed.
success.title: Success

undrainedTime.description:
The time when the node was undrained.
This is the time when the node was undrained after the imaging operation.
undrainedTime.title: Undrained Time

firstNodeDrained.description: The time when the first node was drained.
firstNodeDrained.title: First Node Drained

firstNodeRebooted.description: The time when the first node was rebooted.
firstNodeRebooted.title: First Node Rebooted

lastNodeRebootRecovered.description: The time when the last node recovered post reboot.
lastNodeRebootRecovered.title: Last Node Recovered

lastNodeUndrained.description: The time when the last node was undrained.
lastNodeUndrained.title: Last Node Undrained

result.description:
Result is the overall result of the image operation.
It can be one of the following values:
- "Success": All images were successfully deployed.
- "Failed": No images were successfully deployed.
- "PartialSuccess": Some images were successfully deployed, but not all.
result.title: Result

com.nokia.eda.os.v1alpha1.DeployImageLis.description: DeployImageList is a list of deployimages
